member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.CancelWrite
member.summary: Cancels the current write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is no write operation currently in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0601

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled
member.summary: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if Buffer Underrun Free recording is disabled; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_ClientName
member.summary: Retrieves the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name supplied by the client application.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_CurrentPhysicalMediaType
member.summary: Retrieves the type of media in the disc device.
member.param: Type of media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

You cannot prepare the media until you choose a recorder to use.
Value: 0xC0AA060A

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Note This value does not indicate a NULL pointer.Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_CurrentRotationTypeIsPureCAV
member.summary: Retrieves the current rotational-speed control used by the recorder.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control is in use. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE to indicate that another rotational-speed control that the recorder supports is in use.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

You cannot prepare the media until you choose a recorder to use.
Value: 0xC0AA060A

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
Value: 0xC0AA0301

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_LastPossibleStartOfLeadout
member.summary: Retrieves the last possible starting position for the leadout area.
member.param: Sector address of the starting position for the leadout area.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

Description

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_RequestedRotationTypeIsPureCAV
member.summary: Retrieves the requested rotational-speed control type.
member.param: Requested rotational-speed control type. Is VARIANT_TRUE for constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Otherwise, is VARIANT_FALSE for any other rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_RequestedSectorType
member.summary: Retrieves the requested data sector to use during write of the stream.
member.param: Requested data sector type. For possible values, see .

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_RequestedWriteSpeed
member.summary: Retrieves the requested write speed.

param.name: value
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_StartOfNextSession
member.summary: Retrieves the first sector of the next session.
member.param: Sector number for the start of the next write operation. This value can be negative for blank media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.get_SupportedSectorTypes
member.summary: Retrieves the supported data sector types for the current recorder.

param.name: value
param.para: List of data sector types for the current recorder. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_UI4. The ulVal member of the variant contains the data sector type.
For a list of values of supported sector types, see .

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

The returned pointer is not valid. This value can also indicate that the recorder has not yet been set with .
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.PrepareMedia
member.summary: Locks the current media for exclusive access.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

You cannot prepare the media until you choose a recorder to use.
Value: 0xC0AA060A

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0603

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0606

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0607

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA0604

The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0005

The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0004

The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0006

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.put_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled
member.summary: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to disable Buffer Underrun Free recording; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.put_ClientName
member.summary: Sets the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name of the client application. Cannot be NULL or an empty string.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA0604

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0603

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.put_Recorder
member.summary: Sets the recording device to use for the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value:0xC0AA0603

This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.
Value: 0xC0AA050E

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.put_RequestedSectorType
member.summary: Sets the requested data sector to use for writing the stream.
member.param: Data sector to use for writing the stream. For possible values, see the enumeration type. The default is IMAPI_FORMAT2_RAW_CD_SUBCODE_IS_COOKED.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

The requested data block type is not supported by the current device.
Value: 0xC0AA060E

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.ReleaseMedia
member.summary: Closes a Disc-At-Once (DAO) writing session of a raw image and releases the lock.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.SetWriteSpeed
member.summary: Sets the write speed of the disc recorder.

param.name: RequestedSectorsPerSecond
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media. This is the default.

member.param: Requested rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_TRUE to request constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_FALSE to use another rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
Value: 0xC0AA0003

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0606

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0607

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA0604

The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0005

The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0004

The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0006

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.WriteMedia
member.summary: Writes a DAO-96 raw image to the blank media using MSF 95:00:00 as the starting address.
member.param: An IStream interface of the data stream to write.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The provided audio stream is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA060D

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0602

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0600

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0606

The stream does not contain a sufficient number of sectors in the leadin for the current media.
Value: 0xC0AA060F

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

There is not enough space on the media to add the provided session.
Value: 0xC0AA0609

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The request was canceled.
Value: 0xC0AA0002

member.name: IDiscFormat2RawCD.WriteMedia2
member.summary: Writes a DAO-96 raw image to the blank media using a specified starting address.
member.param: An IStream interface of the data stream to write.
Starting address at which to begin writing the data stream.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

summary.para: Use this interface to write raw images to a disc device using Disc At Once (DAO) mode (also known as uninterrupted recording). For information on DAO mode, see the latest revision of the MMC specification at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5.
To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftDiscFormat2RawCD) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IDiscFormat2RawCD) for the interface identifier.
